page.title: 01THE PARR AREA OF ST.HELENS.
page.content: Our area of study is mainly residential, with some light industry, some farmland and some derelict land. It has been an established industrial area since the late eighteenth century but very few of the original heavy industries now remain, Bold colliery, Bold Power Station and the United Glass Bottle Works being the only exceptions. The country's first industrial canal has been in disuse now for over half a century, although Britain's first passenger railway is still one of the areas main links with Liverpool and Manchester. Recent years have seen a number of attempts by the local authority, both to conserve our industrial past,in the Sankey Valley Project, and to redevelop industrial spoil heaps into Parkland, Fisheries and Industrial Estates.
